info.title: DomainTools Iris Investigate
info.description: Map connected infrastructure to get ahead of threats. The Iris Investigate API delivers dozens of domain name attributes on every result including Risk Score, DNS, Whois, SSL, and more. It enables easy pivoting through different domain name attributes and exposes meaningful insights with connection counts on most data fields. It is best suited for human-scale interactions.

post.description: Returns up to 500 domains that last resolved to a given IPv4 address an active DNS check. Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.

parameters.name: ip
parameters.description: IPv4 address the registered domain was last known to point to during an active DNS check.

post.description: Returns up to 500 domains served by a provided nameserver IP. Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.

parameters.name: nameserver_ip
parameters.description: IP address of the name server.

post.description: Retrieves the infrastructure and whois data associated with a domain or comma-separated list of up to 100 domains.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: Domain (e.g. name.tld) to be investigated or comma-separated list of domains.

post.description: Returns up to 500 domains served by a given mail server IP. Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.

parameters.name: mailserver_ip
parameters.description: IP address of the mail server.

post.description: Returns up to 500 domains with an email address on the most recently available Whois record, DNS SOA record or SSL certificate. Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Email address from the most recently available Whois record, DNS SOA record or SSL certificate.

post.description: Import up to 500 domains from Iris Investigate into the Sentinel platform. Export your investigation by search hash (Iris Investigate -> Search -> Export). Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.

parameters.name: search_hash
parameters.description: Encoded search hash from the Iris Investigate UI (Iris Investigate -> Search -> Export).

post.description: Returns up to 500 domains with a SSL certificate matching a provided SHA-1 hash. Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.
Returns up to 500 domains exactly matching the provided Whois registrant organization field. Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.

parameters.name: registrant_org
parameters.description: Exact match to the Whois registrant organization field.

post.description: Returns up to 500 domains exactly matching the provided Whois registrant field. Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.

parameters.name: registrant
parameters.description: Exact match to the Whois registrant field.

post.description: Returns up to 500 domains with the domain portion of an email address on the most recently available Whois or DNS SOA record. Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.

parameters.name: email_domain
parameters.description: The domain portion of a Whois or DNS SOA email address.

post.description: Returns up to 500 domains with a given email address on the SSL certificate. Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.

parameters.name: ssl_email
parameters.description: Email address from the SSL certificate.

post.description: Returns up to 500 domains served by a provided nameserver host. Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.

parameters.name: nameserver_host
parameters.description: Registered domain portion of the name server.

post.description: Returns up to 500 domains with a mail server on a provided domain name. Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.

parameters.name: mailserver_host
parameters.description: Only the registered domain portion of the mail server (e.g. domain.com).

post.description: Retrieve up to 500 domains tagged within the Iris Investigate UI. Given a comma-separated list of tags, returns domains that are tagged with ANY of the tags. Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.

parameters.name: tagged_with_any
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of Iris Investigate tags. Returns domains tagged with any of the tags in a list.

post.description: Retrieve up to 500 domains tagged within the Iris Investigate UI. Given a comma-separated list of tags, returns domains that are tagged with ALL of the tags. Use the optional 'active' and 'date updated after' parameters to pre-filter the result set.

parameters.name: tagged_with_all
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of tags. Only returns domains tagged with the full list of tags.

get.description: Information of the active API endpoints, rate limits and usage for an account.

limit_exceeded.description: DomainTools API results are limited to 5000 entries in a result set. If a query has more than 5000 results, the 'Limit exceeded' returns true. Try refining your query with more specific search terms.
limit_exceeded.title: Limit Exceeded

has_more_results.description: DomainTools API responses are limited to 500 responses in a single reply. The query can be iterated by adding an optional 'position' parameter to fetch 500 more responses up to a maximum of 5000. Please see https://github.com/DomainTools/python_api/blob/main/examples/retrieving_all_results_in_paginated_return.py for an example
has_more_results.title: Has More Results

Active.name: active
Active.description: Optionally set to 'true' to only return domains that have either an entry in the global DNS system, OR are listed as registered by the registry. Set to 'false' to only return domains that do not have an entry in the global DNS system AND are not listed as registered by the registry.

ActiveDate.name: date_updated_after
ActiveDate.description: Optionally only return domains with activity on or after midnight on a specified date(YYYY-MM-DD)
